newsitem.title: ITALY: Major jokes of "chaffeurless" future-Italy's Prodi.
newsitem.headline: Major jokes of "chaffeurless" future-Italy's Prodi.

text.p: What's the definition of a former prime minister?
"Someone who gets in the back seat of a car, shuts the door and nothing happens," according to British Prime Minister John Major, quoted on Wednesday by Italy's Romano Prodi.
Prodi told foreign reporters that Major cracked the joke about a future without a chauffeur when the two prime ministers last met. They are due to hold talks in London on Friday.
Major is scheduled to call a general election by May. Opinion polls show his Conservatives trailing the Labour Party opposition by 20 points and heading for defeat.
